About Your Provider

Meet Conor Westerman

A provider who combines clinical expertise with personal understanding of the recovery journey.

Credentials

  • PMHNP-BC (Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner — Board Certified)
  • Arizona License #227933
  • 10+ years mental health experience
  • The Meadows Behavioral Healthcare trained
  • Dr. Claudia Black mentorship

A Journey of Recovery and Purpose

More than 13 years ago, I found myself at a crossroads that many of my patients know well. Struggling with addiction, I couldn't see a way forward. Today, I'm living proof that recovery isn't just possible—it's the beginning of a fuller, more meaningful life.

That experience didn't just shape my personal life; it became the foundation of my professional calling. When I work with patients facing depression, addiction, trauma, or the weight of daily stress, I bring more than clinical knowledge. I bring genuine understanding.

Clinical Excellence

My decade in mental health includes years at The Meadows Behavioral Healthcare, one of the nation's most respected treatment centers for trauma and addiction. There, I had the privilege of learning from pioneers like Dr. Claudia Black, whose work on family systems and addiction recovery has helped countless people heal.

Board-certified as a Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner, I combine evidence-based medication management with a deep understanding of what actually helps people get better—not just clinically, but in their real lives.

My Approach

I believe in treating the whole person—mind, body, and spirit. My faith has been a cornerstone of my own recovery, and I understand that healing often involves more than just finding the right medication. It's about rebuilding hope, reconnecting with purpose, and finding the strength to show up for your life again.

That said, I welcome patients of all backgrounds and beliefs. What matters most is that you feel heard, respected, and supported on your own terms. We'll work together to find what works for you.

Treatment Approaches

Trauma-Informed Care

Understanding how past experiences shape present challenges

Cognitive Behavioral (CBT)

Practical strategies to change unhelpful thinking patterns

Dialectical Behavior (DBT)

Skills for managing intense emotions and relationships

Motivational Interviewing

Collaborative conversations that strengthen motivation for change

12-Step Friendly

Supportive of recovery programs and community connections

Person-Centered

Your goals, your pace, your journey

Ready to Get Started?

If you're looking for a provider who truly understands, I'd be honored to be part of your journey.
